title: No option to logout concurrent sessions

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
**Description**
When I login to Hackerone using two different computers I can easily browse the session concurrently . This means that if an attacker somehow knows password of user by any means he can login using that info and the main user will not get notified.

**FIX**
If someone else login to a account, the main user should get a notification or there should a section to see all active sessions and to terminate them.

activities.message:
This is a good find for most websites that address a less tech savvy user base. However, we intentionally allow simultaneous sessions for a few reasons. The most compelling reason is that many response team members, but also researchers, browse the site with two browsers at the same time: a completely sandboxed browser (for testing purposes, like executing potentially dangerous proof of concept code) and a more regular browser to use the site to interact with bug reports. 

We're planning a few improvements that make the session system a bit more resilient, like 2 factor authentication, active sessions overview etc, but as we're a quite young site this is not on the top of our list.

> No option to logout concurrent sessions

I must add that there definitelty is an option to logout all concurrent sessions. This feature is called 'Sign out' and is available from the dropdown menu right next to your avatar.

activities.message: Yes, that is correct and that is addressed extensively in @jobert's comment (the upcoming functionality we are planning around this). My reply was just to add that we do have the ability to sign out all active sessions (reset your password, or just click plain 'Sign out'). Your report title seemed to indicate that this was not possible, which is why I replied.
